The problem is asking if it is possible to distribute the cookies in such a way that each of the three goats gets the same number of cookies.

If the product of the number of cookies in each tin is even, then we can always find a way to distribute the cookies in this way.

For example, if A = 4 and B = 5, then the product is 4 * 5 = 20. If we distribute the 20 cookies in pairs, each of the three goats can have 20 / 3 = 6 cookies. So, the answer is yes.

If the product of the number of cookies in each tin is not even, then we cannot distribute the cookies in such a way that each of the three goats gets the same number of cookies.

A B

-----Sample Input-----
4 5

-----Sample Output-----
Possible
